intents.patterns: how are glacier caves formed
intents.responses: A glacier cave is a cave formed within the ice of a glacier .

intents.patterns: How are the directions of the velocity and force vectors related in a circular motion
intents.responses: In physics , circular motion is a movement of an object along the circumference of a circle or rotation along a circular path.

intents.patterns: who was apollo creed
intents.responses: Apollo Creed is a fictional character from the Rocky films , initially portrayed as the Undisputed Heavyweight Champion of the World.

intents.patterns: who played apollo creed
intents.responses: He was played by Carl Weathers .

intents.patterns: what were apollo creed's nicknames
intents.responses: Creed had multiple nicknames, including The Master of Disaster, The King of Sting, The Dancing Destroyer, The Prince of Punch, The One and Only and The Count of Monte Fisto.

intents.patterns: how did apollo creed get his name
intents.responses: Urban legend states that Apollo Creed's name is a wordplay on the Apostles' Creed , a statement of belief used in Christian churches.

intents.patterns: how long were apollo creed fights
intents.responses: All of Apollo's championship fights were scheduled for the 15 round distance.

intents.patterns: When did championship fights change length
intents.responses: Championship fights did not convert from 15 rounds to 12 rounds until 1987.

intents.patterns: Who popularized red, white, and blue trunks
intents.responses: Rocky Balboa is often wrongly credited with popularizing the red, white, and blue trunks; Creed was the first man to wear them (latterly worn by Rocky Balboa in the 3rd and 4th installments and finally by Tommy "The Machine" Gunn ( Tommy Morrison ) in the 5th installment) although normally he wore red and white, as seen in Rocky II.

intents.patterns: What were Rocky Balboa's signature colors
intents.responses: Balboa's signature colors were black and gold—colors he used in the latest movie .

intents.patterns: how are federal judges appointed
intents.responses: In the United States, the title of federal judge usually means a judge appointed by the President of the United States and confirmed by the United States Senate pursuant to the Appointments Clause in Article II of the United States Constitution .

intents.patterns: What types of federal courts are there
intents.responses: In addition to the Supreme Court of the United States , whose existence and some aspects of whose jurisdiction are beyond the constitutional power of Congress to alter, acts of Congress have established 13 courts of appeals (also called "circuit courts") with appellate jurisdiction over different regions of the United States, and 94 United States district courts .

intents.patterns: Who are federal judges
intents.responses: Every judge appointed to such a court may be categorized as a federal judge; such positions include the Chief Justice and Associate Justices of the Supreme Court, Circuit Judges of the courts of appeals, and district judges of the United States district courts .

intents.patterns: Why are they called federal judges
intents.responses: All of these judges described thus far are referred to sometimes as "Article III judges" because they exercise the judicial power vested in the judicial branch of the federal government by Article III of the U.S. Constitution.

intents.patterns: how do federal judges affect trade
intents.responses: In addition, judges of the Court of International Trade exercise judicial power pursuant to Article III.

intents.patterns: What are the other powers of federal judges
intents.responses: Other judges serving in the federal courts, including magistrate judges and bankruptcy judges , are also sometimes referred to as "federal judges"; however, they are neither appointed by the President nor confirmed by the Senate, and their power derives from Article I instead.

intents.patterns: What is a beretta model 21 pistol
intents.responses: The Beretta 21A Bobcat is a small pocket-sized semi-automatic pistol designed by Beretta in Italy.

intents.patterns: When were beretta model 21 pistols invented
intents.responses: Production began in late 1984, solely in the Beretta U.S.A. facility in Accokeek, Maryland.

intents.patterns: What model of beretta preceded the model 21 pistols
intents.responses: It is a further development of the Beretta Model 20, whose production ended in 1985.

intents.patterns: how a vul works
intents.responses: Variable Universal Life Insurance (often shortened to VUL) is a type of life insurance that builds a cash value. In a VUL, the cash value can be invested in a wide variety of separate accounts , similar to mutual funds , and the choice of which of the available separate accounts to use is entirely up to the contract owner.

intents.patterns: what does vul mean
intents.responses: The 'variable' component in the name refers to this ability to invest in separate accounts whose values vary—they vary because they are invested in stock and/or bond markets.

intents.patterns: how an outdoor wood boiler works
intents.responses: The outdoor wood boiler is a variant of the classic wood stove adapted for set-up outdoors while still transferring the heat to interior buildings.

intents.patterns: why do girl scout sell boxes of cookies
intents.responses: Girl Scout Cookies are cookies sold by Girl Scouts of the USA (GSUSA) as one of its major fundraisers for local Scout units.

intents.patterns: When did girl scouts start selling cookies
intents.responses: Members of the GSUSA have been selling cookies since 1917 to raise funds.

intents.patterns: What conference is purdue in
intents.responses: Today, Purdue is a member of the Big Ten Conference , and is a well known world-class research institution.

intents.patterns: how big is the purdue student body
intents.responses: Purdue enrolls the second largest student body of any university in Indiana as well as the fourth largest international student population of any university in the United States.

intents.patterns: what degrees does purdue offer
intents.responses: Purdue offers both undergraduate and graduate programs in over 211 major areas of study, and is well known for its competitive engineering curricula.

intents.patterns: what is sebaceous cysts
intents.responses: A sebaceous cyst is a term that loosely refers to either epidermoid cysts (also known as epidermal cysts; L72.0 ) or pilar cysts (also known as trichilemmal cysts; L72.1 ).

intents.patterns: how do you get sebaceous cysts
intents.responses: Because an epidermoid cyst originates in the epidermis and a pilar cyst originates from hair follicles , by definition, neither type of cyst is strictly a sebaceous cyst.

intents.patterns: how are pointe shoes made
intents.responses: The edge of the toe pad, which is inserted between the foot and toe box for cushioning, can be seen on the right foot.

intents.patterns: what are pointe shoes
intents.responses: A pointe shoe is a type of shoe worn by ballet dancers when performing pointe work .

intents.patterns: what colors are pointe shoes made
intents.responses: They are manufactured in a variety of colors, most commonly in shades of light pink.

intents.patterns: how much is 1 tablespoon of water
intents.responses: This tablespoon has a capacity of about 15 mL.

intents.patterns: how do you measure 1 tablespoon of water
intents.responses: Measuring Spoons

intents.patterns: what is a tablespoon
intents.responses: In the US and parts of Canada, a tablespoon is the largest type of spoon used for eating from a bowl. In the UK, Europe and most Commonwealth countries, a tablespoon is a type of large spoon usually used for serving.

intents.patterns: what is the abbreviation for tablespoon
intents.responses: It is abbreviated as T, tb, tbs, tbsp, tblsp, or tblspn.
